Increase their speed so as to ease the movement of such vehicle
Reduce their speed, and if need be, stop or move aside so as to ease the movemen of such vehicle
questions.correctAnswer: Reduce their speed, and if need be, stop or move aside so as to ease the movemen of such vehicle

questions.question: It is prohibited to overtake:
answers: If the road is broken into multiple lanes with broken lines
On narrow or steep mountain road
questions.correctAnswer: On narrow or steep mountain road

questions.question: On approaching an intersection, the driver should:
answers: Keep to the right side of the road
Check that the road he is about to cross is clear
Keep moving without checking first that the road is clear
questions.correctAnswer: Check that the road he is about to cross is clear

questions.question: A driver who is about to leave the road he is on to another road on the right should:
answers: Tilt a little to the left but remain on the road
Keep to the left side of the road
Keep to the right side of the road
questions.correctAnswer: Keep to the right side of the road

questions.question: A driver who is about to leave the road he is on to another road on the left should:
answers: Keep to the middle, without tilting left or right
Tilt a little to the right but remain on the road
Tilt a little to the left but remain on the road
questions.correctAnswer: Tilt a little to the left but remain on the road

questions.question: When the driver is about to leave on road and get on another one, the driver should:
answers: Make the appropriate turn with utmost speed so as not to misaccommodate others

questions.question: It is best to keep a "safe Distance":
answers: From all sides of the vehicle

From the front and the end sides only
questions.correctAnswer: From all sides of the vehicle

questions.question: It is important to allow a "safe distance" because
answers: It gives drivers the time to react to what happens
It gives other vehicles a chance to enter the lane

questions.question: A solid green light at the intersection means:
answers: You should stop and check traffic in the other direction before you carry on

questions.correctAnswer: You can cross the intersetion if it is posisble

questions.question: A flashing yellow light means:

questions.question: A yellow light on the intersection means:
answers: Reduce your speed and be ready to stop
questions.correctAnswer: Reduce your speed and be ready to stop

questions.question: If you have a flat tyre while youre traveling:
answers: Let the steering wheel take the reigns

Press on the brakes to slow down, and pull off the road
questions.correctAnswer: Release the accelerator to allow the vehicle to slow down, keep the steering wheel straight, and pull off the road

questions.question: If the lights of the vehicle traveling on the opposite direction are bothering you, you should:
answers: Look towards the middle of the road
Look towards the left side of the road

questions.correctAnswer: Look down, and towards the right side of the road

answers: Wait inside the vehicle until the road assistance vehicle reaches you

questions.correctAnswer: Wait inside the vehicle until the road assistance vehicle reaches you

questions.question: When you enter a highway, you should:
answers: The driver may not change lanes if the broken line is to the left
questions.correctAnswer: The driver may not change lanes if the broken line is to the left

questions.question: If a vehicle is pressing behind you, and you are on the left lane on a freeway, you should:
